title: Nuking Hurricanes
summary: Trump repeatedly suggested dropping nuclear bombs into hurricanes to disrupt them before landfall. NOAA had to publish explainer on why this would be catastrophic (radioactive fallout, wouldn't stop hurricane).
keyFacts: Multiple occasions (2017-2019): Trump repeatedly suggested dropping nuclear bombs into hurricanes
Reportedly asked senior officials: 'Why don't we nuke them?'
NOAA had to publish explainer on why this would be catastrophic
Would spread radioactive fallout, not actually stop the hurricane
Officials said briefing was interrupted by Trump asking about nukes so often they had to address it

sources.text: Axios: Trump suggested dropping nuclear bombs into hurricanes to stop them from hitting the U.S.
CNN: Axios: Trump floated the idea of using nuclear bombs to stop hurricanes headed for US
PolitiFact: Can a nuclear bomb stop a hurricane? No, it's a myth that has persisted for decades
Snopes: Did Trump Ask Advisers About 'Nuking' Hurricanes?
